description: Providing birth education to empowered women everywhere. It's time to take back birth.
title: Taking Back Birth

episodes.title: The Spiritual Side of the End of Pregnancy
episodes.description:
Not so many intellectual thoughts here at the end; but lots of feeling, and dreaming and processing my pregnancy experience thus far. This finishes up baby #10’s pregnancy; and on this podcast I share my thoughts and dreams for birth as well as the overall themes of deep spirituality that were gifted to me over...

Read More

episodes.title: Should I Have a Freebirth With My First Baby?
episodes.description:
Hah, trick question. My answer when people ask me is: I have no idea! What I DO care about if someone asks is that they think about what they want, what they want their ENTIRE experience to feel like (NOT just the birth!) and if they’re ready to get real with themselves about their own...

Read More

episodes.title: Mothering Q&A
episodes.description: In this Mothering podcast, I take the easy way out and answer a bunch of questions from our social network. I ended up blabbing about how it looks in our house with childcare, how we keep our house clean and how I think about relationships and spending time with each of them alone. Enjoy!

episodes.title: 10 Questions to Ask Your Higher (Pregnant) Self
episodes.description:
On this podcast, I use Danielle LaPorte as inspiration in a few different ways. Join me as I reflect on what it means to connect with your higher consciousness in pregnancy; how the state of the world is requiring more of this from us (like never before), and how some or all of these questions...

Read More

episodes.title: Mothering #4: Food, Eating and our Family
episodes.description:
Join me on this continuation of my mothering series. In this episode, I talk about my beliefs around food and kids and how ultimately I have settled on trying to control less and allow more freedom. I also share how food often looks in our house; where it comes from, who makes it and how...

Read More

episodes.title: The Spiritual Experience of Early Pregnancy (And Yes, I’m Pregnant Again)
episodes.description:
"Enough of phrases, conceit, and metaphors, I want burning, burning, burning." -Rumi Here’s the correct quote to this podcast; my newly pregnant brain got it wrong Here’s to hoping that you enjoy this more spiritual dive into the early pregnancy experience. Full of growth and realization and the mystery of these souls that come in!...

Read More

episodes.title: First Babies Can Fall Out But Often They Don’t
episodes.description:
Margo and I chat together on this one after a recent run of first births in our own work. We also compiled some fun stats, looking at the many first births we’ve attended over the years and the percentages of long, fast, etc. We hope you enjoy the close look into the midwife’s perspective on...

Read More

episodes.title: The Initiation of Man: Two Nine-Time Fathers Talk About the Magic of Birth
episodes.description: Listen in as two nine-time fathers (my husband Jason and great friend, supporter of Indie Birth and wise elder, Thom Knoles) talk about the magic of birth!

episodes.title: The Birth Nerd Series: The Basics of Fundal Measurement
episodes.description:
This sounds really boring, but I promise you that it is quick, and fun! I wanted to record this for all the mamas and students that are constantly wondering about fundal height; and maybe stressing about the measurement or just wanting more information about this in general. Let us know what questions you have, and...

Read More

episodes.title: How We Named Our Babies
episodes.description:
Who doesn’t love talking about names? Join me in this podcast about baby names! First, a short update from my perspective on some world events...and then time spent on why, how and when people name their babies, as well as how I came to the names of our children. I hope you enjoy this and...

Read More

episodes.title: Body Scan Guided Meditation to Raise Your Vibration
episodes.description:
Join me in this meditation for raising your vibration in this time of virus pandemic and severe psychological challenge! We don’t have control over the world, or each other, but we can be responsible for our inner state of consciousness. I hope you enjoy this simple guided body scan that may help you replace negative...

Read More

episodes.title: Mothering #3: Rites of Passage
episodes.description:
In this Mothering podcast, I talk about my own experiences and thoughts around all the various transitions or “rites of passage” that babies and young kids might experience. When they experience these things, so do we! I cover some examples from night weaning to losing teeth, and explore why these transitions are such big deals...

Read More

episodes.title: I Can’t Afford a Homebirth and Other Money Issues
episodes.description:
Here it is...my thoughts and experiences around money and energy in the world of birth. Whether you are a birthing woman, a doula or midwife, I hope you will take what resonates with you and leave the rest. The way “out” of the current confusing conversation around birth/midwifery care happens when we have these conversations....

Read More

episodes.title: Waterbirth? Yay or Nay?
episodes.description: Maryn and Margo chat together on this episode about all things waterbirth; why people might choose it, why they might choose it, what we notice as midwives and how we come back to the same belief each and every time…choose what is best for you! Download this podcast transcript

episodes.title: Birth: the Greatest Opportunity For a Guy to Be a Man
episodes.description:
This episode isn’t me blabbing about birth from my perspective. Instead, I handed the mic over to my husband Jason, and good friend Nathan, so that they could talk about birth in the way that only 2 guys (with some very varied and unique birth experiences!) could. Share this podcast chat with the men in...

Read More

episodes.title: Mothering #2: “Schooling” and Our Kids
episodes.description:
“When you take the free will out of education, that turns it into schooling.”-John Taylor Gatto Come with me on this ramble as I share my thoughts on formal education, my own story and what my hopes are for my own children. This is a big and touchy topic but since it relates so much...

Read More

episodes.title: A Birth At the Ashram
episodes.description:
Listen in on my chat with Eve; an amazing young woman who recently birthed her first baby, Sofiah, in her complete power! I was honored to meet Eve just weeks before her birth, and just as honored to attend her birth at the beautiful Divine Grace Ashram in Arizona on gorgeous, sacred land in the...

Read More

episodes.title: Ask the Midwife: From Gloves to Cameras and Back Again
episodes.description: This is half an hour of me reading and answering some questions we were sent by students in our doula program, the Birth Warrior Project. If you have questions to ask us, just send us an email. To read more, go to https://indiebirth.org/birthwarriorproject

episodes.title: Mothering #1
episodes.description:
I’m starting a mini-series within my Taking Back Birth podcast series and it is all about MOTHERING. ** Mothering is so far reaching; way beyond the birth we generally focus on. Yet, I spend literal HOURS and hours counseling women and walking along side them and it is not lost on me how so much...

episodes.title: Recipe for a Perfect Birth
episodes.description:
Listen in on my “Recipe for a Perfect Birth”! ** Spoiler alert for this podcast: There IS NO recipe for a “perfect birth”; and what does that mean anyhow? Join me as I look into the close up view on things we think matter. Then, we’ll back up our view and consider that maybe nothing...

Read More

episodes.title: The Honest Truth About Freebirth
episodes.description:
Here’s my truth: I’ve personally experienced freebirth AND I’m in the role of midwife and I do not see those two things as mutually exclusive. However, I do have some thoughts/questions and maybe some wisdom to share around what I see the freebirth movement as. I want us all to question the good, the bad and...

Read More

episodes.title: Chatting With Madeline of Believe in Midwifery
episodes.description:
Join me as I chat with midwife Madeline Murray of Believe in Midwifery. One of the best parts of this “job” is that I get to connect with fantastic midwives of all types. Madeline is so enthusiastic and smart and I can’t wait to see how her passion begins to change the current state of...

Read More

episodes.title: The Fantastic First Hour After Birth
episodes.description:
I loved looking deeper in to this idea of the “first hour after birth”. I definitely learned things too and I want to share these thoughts (and findings and ponderings!) with you. Mostly, I find it interesting how far we can stray, as a culture, from our instinct and knowing. There are so many modern...

Read More

episodes.title: Wisdom About a Baby’s Transition Earthside
episodes.description:
Becoming a human on earth required us all to TRANSITION to life here. ** In this podcast I talk about all of the ways that a baby needs to adapt; from the obvious taking of breaths to what it might mean in a spiritual sense to cross the veil. I share my own experiences and...

Read More

episodes.title: ANOTHER chat with the Badass OB, Nathan Riley
episodes.description:
He’s the only doctor to be on my podcast twice...what an honor! For me, I mean. Listen in on this “Midwife and doctor” conversation (how often do we imagine THAT conversation happening?!) as we talk about: Shame and blame... How we can help create balance in the birth world How much work there is to...

Read More

episodes.title: Why Health Insurance Shouldn’t Factor Into Your Birth Plan
episodes.description:
I know, I Know...what?! I am hoping for some huge cultural shifts (and maybe some email responses) around this podcast. I can’t keep quiet any longer that I am TIRED of women/people abdicating responsibility for their birth in a myriad of ways...one of which is the entire paradigm of someone ELSE paying for your birth...

episodes.title: Unpopular Thoughts About Labor Pain
episodes.description:
In this podcast, I am a free-flow channel for my most current and most true thoughts and feelings about the topic of “pain in labor”. Have you thought about this word “pain” or about the sensations of birth in general? Agree with me, be offended...whatever! Hoping to spark some deeper conversation into this well-loved topic....

Read More

episodes.title: A Chat With Midwife Kerrie Adams
episodes.description: On this podcast, I had the pleasure of speaking with Australian midwife Kerrie Adams; about her own births, her own power and how she wants to reform the system for midwives. You can find her at https://www.instagram.com/the_kerrie_adams/

episodes.title: Spiritual Midwifery with RainMa
episodes.description: Join me as I chat with my friend Amber (RainMa) about spiritual midwifery, taking full responsibility and honoring the Divine in our work as women. You can find Amber at: https://www.asouljournerstruth.me Download this podcasts transcript

episodes.title: Brittany and Conor Share Their Autonomous Birth Experience
episodes.description: On this podcast, I talk with my friends Brittany and Conor about their autonomous pregnancy and birth experience. These are some of my absolute favorite people, and I know they will inspire tons of people with their authenticity, rawness and humor surrounding the birth of Ilya, their first baby.

episodes.title: More On Pregnancy Loss
episodes.description:
Come along with me as I share what it’s like to hold space for everything from first trimester miscarriage to full term stillbirth. These aren’t easy conversations but I honor all the women that have invited me into their space for this reason; thank you for the opportunity to grow. I also want to see...

Read More

episodes.title: Being In the “Flow State” At Births
episodes.description:
I recorded this podcast chat with my friend Annika! We work together here locally attending births and we had recently gotten into a fun conversation that we attempted to duplicate here. Listen in as we chat about what “flow state” is, how we might desire being in that place as a birth attendant, how to...

Read More

episodes.title: Margo’s Second Birth – Maryn and Margo Share Aero’s Birth Story
episodes.description:
Listen in as Margo and I talk together (and we were actually together, in the same room) about her second homebirth. We recorded just just a few days after Aero was born in her bathroom, so it’s a real and raw review of her birth story. I know this will inspire women everywhere and that...

Read More

episodes.title: Christina’s HBAC Story
episodes.description:
In this podcast, Christina shares her story of a stressful second pregnancy, an IUGR diagnosis and the desire to have a VBAC! Seriously, this is such an inspiring tale no matter what your own scenario is that will remind you of a woman’s strength, power and true ability to KNOW what is right for her....

episodes.title: How I Rewired My Brain to Remove Pain From My Birth Experience
episodes.description:
In this podcast, I talk about how I prepared for Cove’s birth regarding pain and my desire for this birth experience to be simple and without pain. I don’t have a magic formula, but her birth was everything and more that I had hoped! My wish is that sharing this experience with you might help...

episodes.title: Talking About the State of Birth with a “Badass OB,” Nathan Riley MD
episodes.description:
On this podcast, I talked with Nathan Riley, OB/GYN; after finding Nathan’s podcast, I was inspired to contact him because he seemed like not-your-typical-OB. I was right! Tune in as we chat about his own training, the state of birth and obstetrics and what’s most important as we serve women and families in this work....

Read More

episodes.title: Mantras For Birth
episodes.description:
I made and recorded this podcast at the end of my 9th pregnancy; about 2 weeks before Cove came earthside! These are the mantras and thoughts I had in preparing for her birth, which turned out to be a really fast and painless experience. I hope these mantras are as helpful to you as you...

Read More

episodes.title: Walking Between the Worlds At the End of Pregnancy
episodes.description:
In this podcast, I share my experiences from the end of pregnancy. Written words aren’t the best to express the feelings at the end of a pregnancy; relief, excitement, anticipation and a general feeling of being caught between worlds. I reflect on the things I am feeling and how labor isn’t really an event but...

episodes.title: The Six Steps of Healing For Birth
episodes.description:
We talk a lot about Susun Weed’s “6 Steps of Healing” here at Indie Birth, and I thought it would be fun to talk through the steps from a birth perspective. This would be helpful for pregnant and birthing women who have issues or problems they think they need to solve; from something like heartburn,...

episodes.title: A Conversation For Midwives About Taking Babies to Births
episodes.description:
In this podcast, I share my experience and suggestions around bringing my own babies to homebirths over the years. In 14 years of midwifing, I’ve brought more than 6 of my babies to “work” with me, and I want to share what has worked, what has not, and what you might expect if this is...

episodes.title: Exploring Autonomy in Birth
episodes.description: What is autonomy in birth? What does it look like? What does it look like? That's what we explore in this episode.

episodes.title: A High-Risk Pregnancy and Birth Story
episodes.description:
Watch and/or listen to this birth story podcast and video by a woman who had her 6th baby at home against all odds! It was a pleasure walking with this smart woman and her family as they navigated their choices and what was best for them, their baby and this birth. Stories like these remind...

episodes.title: Prenatal Clinic Part I: Do you need a first prenatal visit?
episodes.description:
After 9 months of holding a free prenatal clinic here locally, the same questions and topics keep coming up, so I thought I’d share some of that with my podcast listeners. I’m hoping it maybe helps you start a prenatal clinic in your area, or maybe you are a mama who also would love the...

episodes.title: Feeling Your Baby Move
episodes.description:
The podcast this week is all about baby movement in the womb. This podcast is all about movement; when do babies start to move? When do we actually feel it, on average? What other factors influence how much baby movement we feel and what is “normal”? I share some helpful information as well as my...

Read More

episodes.title: A Meditation For Midwives For Calming Fear
episodes.description:
I created this short meditation for one of my Indie Birth Midwifery School classes after the students had been studying for many weeks about complications in pregnancy. I wanted to finish the course by reminding them, myself and anyone else that our brains can learn many things, but we must always bring our hearts back...

episodes.title: Listening To My Spirit Baby
episodes.description:
In this podcast, I share about my experience in this pregnancy so far. I realize that no matter how many babies I have had, each requires me to “be” in the pregnancy state in a different way. This baby has had very specific messages for me, if only I would listen! Tune in to hear...

episodes.title: Julie and Joe’s First Homebirth
episodes.description:
On this podcast, I had the honor of chatting with a family I supported almost a year ago in their first home birth. Joe and Julie are truly some of my favorite people, and you will hear (and see!) why. They are the picture of powerful; they created an ordinary (in the best sense of...

episodes.title: The First Few Moons of Pregnancy
episodes.description: In this episode, I talk about taking the first few months of pregnancy "out of the box" it's been placed in and truly appreciating it for the magical time that it is. Download this Podcast Transcript

episodes.title: Rachel’s Journey Through Eclampsia
episodes.description:
I recorded this podcast for my class, “multidimensional midwifery in the prenatal period: how to prepare yourself for prenatal complications,” as our students were studying pre-eclampsia and HELLP syndrome. I came across Rachel Bandstra, on one of our Indie Birth Facebook groups who was (briefly) sharing her story of having prenatal eclampsia in her first...

episodes.title: Am I Pregnant? Being Present in the Mystical Space of Not Knowing
episodes.description: In this podcast, I sit with you in the mystical space of "not knowing" whether or not you're pregnant. Download the PDF transcription of this podcast, Am I Pregnant_

episodes.title: Mothers At Birth: How to Make the Right Decision For You About Inviting Your Mother To Your Birth
episodes.description: This podcast is all about making the right choice, for you, about whether or not to invite your mother to your birth. There's a lot to think about! Download this podcast transcript

episodes.description: On this podcast, Margo and I talk about one of our favorite topics: birth in media! Download this podcasts transcript

episodes.title: Dealing With Depression and Anxiety
episodes.description:
This podcast is all about incorporating more "inside work" into life during pregnancy and postpartum! I definitely feel like talking about “mindfulness” is not optional, but I also know it is not the most popular topic because it requires a bit of dedication and commitment! Getting started with a mindfulness practice is absolutely essential if...

episodes.title: Annika Shares the Birth Story of Ruby
episodes.description:
My podcast this week is a birth story, told by my apprentice and friend, Annika! Annika birthed her first baby, Ruby, several months ago, and we finally got around to connecting together over this tale. I loved hearing Annika’s version from memory (always different than reading a story!) and loved the lessons and new experiences...

This podcast is for a specific group of people, although anyone is invited to listen and share! This podcast is for women planning a home birth for the first time! To be clear; that is not someone that is planning their first birth, but rather for women that have experienced one or more medicalized births...

episodes.title: Reflections on My First Year Living With a Deva
episodes.description:
In this podcast, I reflect on my feelings and observations around Deva’s birth, which was a year ago! I talk about the video we made of her birth (you can watch it at www.thebirthmovie.com) and how it has changed me; and Margo, and Indie Birth in general! I also discuss how it feels to “remember”...

episodes.title: Changing the World For Families: The Uncensored Story of Indie Birth
episodes.description:
This week, I got right to podcast-making with a never been heard before on a podcast rendition of the "Indie Birth story". I felt for a while (many years) that this story was "old news" and that everyone I knew had heard my tale of giving my midwifery license back, etc. But, with such an...

episodes.description: On this podcast, Margo and I talk about fast labors. Come along as we walk and talk!

episodes.title: When Homebirth Doesn’t Happen and Transport Becomes the Best Choice
episodes.description:
In this podcast, I talk about homebirth to hospital transports. Why is there such stigma around this? How do we talk about “needed” transport in an era of midwifery at home being defined by “rules and regulations? How do we deal emotionally with transport when we are the mamas? Or the Midwives? This is an...

episodes.title: The Sable Journal: Selected Readings From My 15 Week Journey Carrying My Dead Son
episodes.description:
In this podcast, I talk for the first time in more detail about my 15 week son who died, and who remained in my body for almost 15 weeks! I kept many journals over this time, and during this podcast, I reflect on my journal entries and some thoughts I’ve had in hindsight about the...

episodes.title: Wise Woman Nutrition For the Vegan Mama with Bridget Nielsen
episodes.description: On this podcast, I talk with my friend and vegan food expert, Bridget Nielsen. You can find her recipes and more at her website, www.bridgetnielsen.com and on her YouTube channel. Download this podcasts PDF transcript

episodes.description: On this podcast, a new "supplement" to Taking Back Birth, I talk with Margo while I walk with Margo! The main topic for today is FOOD! Download this podcasts transcript

episodes.description:
In this episode of Taking Back Birth, Maryn talks about kids at birth using her experience with home birth as a mom and midwife. She shares stories and discusses many things to consider for your own family when exploring this topic. For Maryn, birth is a part of life and she never considered not having...

episodes.title: Straight Talk About the New NRP Guidelines
episodes.description:
On this podcast, I asked one of my fellow midwife friends, Angee Hock, to have a fun chat with me. Somehow, we decided to talk about neonatal resuscitation (or NRP) and our experiences resuscitating babies. We also touched on the idea of certifying this kind of knowledge in general (is it worth it, is it...

episodes.title: How Not To Go Crazy – Indie Birth Walk and Talk Episode 1
episodes.description: On this podcast, a new "supplement" to Taking Back Birth, I talk with Margo while I walk with Margo! The main topic is about how to take care of yourself so you don't go crazy!

episodes.title: Restoring Women’s Choice For Vaginal Breech Birth: My Chat with Researcher Dr. Rixa Freeze
episodes.description:
On this podcast, I had the honor of talking to one of the smartest women in birth! Dr. Rixa Freeze is a home birthing mama, but also one of the only researchers focused on vaginal breech birth. She is a wealth of knowledge, and has so many exciting projects on the horizon that the birth...

episodes.title: Haters Gonna Hate: Social Media and the New Birth Paradigm
episodes.description:
On this podcast, I talk about the negative effect that I think social media is having on the birth world and birthing women. It’s truly another “reality,” but is this the reality we want to create and live in? There are positives to the online world as well, but I invite you to think consciously...

episodes.title: Doing It At Home: Behind the Scenes of the Popular Home Birth Podcast
episodes.description:
I love doing interviews and on this podcast, I get to interview another podcaster! Today I talk with Sarah Bivens, who hosts the podcast "Doing It At Home", with her husband, Matthew. I found their podcast and fell in love with it without because, a) it's about home birth and b) it's just brutally honest...

episodes.description: In this episode of Taking Back Birth, I offer my ideas about how to balance the art of midwifery with the art of mothering.

episodes.description:
In this episode of Taking Back Birth, I speak with my sacred sister, Lisa Lister, about her journey to help women take back their power. Crowned ‘the defender of female awesomeness’ by Cooler magazine, Lisa Lister is an advocate of the FULL female experience. She's a writer, a menstrual maven and creatrix of the SHE...

episodes.description: In this episode of Taking Back Birth, I talk about that time, just days after birth, where you're neither "here nor there." You're no longer pregnant, but you haven't yet adjusted. There are a lot of feelings that can come up during these days, so listen in!

episodes.description: In this episode of Taking Back Birth, I got to answer some questions from Scott Kirschenbaum (OfWomanBornFilm.com) about labor...while in labor! Download this podcasts transcript

In this episode of Taking Back Birth, Maryn talks about the Sacred Blood Mysteries and how they have been lost in our modern patriarchal society, as well as how we can remember and honor them. How can we help women connect to this deeper knowledge we all have within that can support us with our...
